behaviours

Class PoolBallManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jogamp.java3d.SceneGraphObject
      • org.jogamp.java3d.Node
        • org.jogamp.java3d.Leaf
          • org.jogamp.java3d.Behavior
            • behaviours.PoolBallManager

  • public class PoolBallManager
extends org.jogamp.java3d.Behavior
    Class for spawning, interacting, and colliding pool balls.

    Use getTG() to get the transform group that contains all the pool balls. The origin of the tg is the centre of the pool table, where +z is towards the baulk line.

      • poolballs

        private PoolBall[] poolballs
        Array of all 22 pool balls to iterate over.
        Each ball should be at a certain index.
        Some pool balls may be null as they get deleted when scored.

        0 = Cue ball
        1 = Black ball
        2 = Pink ball
        3 = Blue ball
        4 = Brown ball
        5 = Green ball
        6 = Yellow ball
        7-21 = 15 Red balls

      • tg

        private org.jogamp.java3d.TransformGroup tg
        The transform group that contains all the pool balls.
        The origin of this transform group is the centre of the table.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PoolBallManager

        public PoolBallManager()

    • Method Detail

      • getTG

        public org.jogamp.java3d.TransformGroup getTG()
        Returns the transform group that stores all the pool balls.

        The origin is the centre of the pool table where +z is towards the baulk line and +x is to the right of that direction.

        Returns:
        The TransformGroup that contains all the pool balls

      • addPyramid

        private void addPyramid(int index,
                        int layers,
                        PoolBall.Type type,
                        double x,
                        double z)
        Adds multiple pool balls in a equilateral pyramid shape at the given coord.
        It will always grow the pyramid towards -z.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to start from
        layers - The number of layers in the pyramid
        type - The type of pool ball to spawn
        x - The x-coord of the first pool ball, at the top of the pyramid
        z - The z-coord of the first pool ball, at the top of the pyramid

      • addBall

        private void addBall(int i,
                     PoolBall.Type type,
                     double x,
                     double z)
        Shortcut function for adding pool balls for the constructor
        Parameters:
        i - Index to add to
        type - PoolBall.Type of pool ball to add
        x - x position to set to
        z - y position to set to

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Specified by:
        initialize in class org.jogamp.java3d.Behavior

      • strikeCueBall

        public void strikeCueBall(float angle,
                          float power)
        Starts moving the cue ball in the given direction at the given power.

        You're fine to pass a negative power to strike the ball backwards.

        Parameters:
        angle - The x-z plane angle to aim at, in radians, where 0 aims towards +z
        power - The speed at which the ball should move, in j3d units per second

      • movePoolBalls

        public void movePoolBalls()
        Moves all the pool balls based on their velocity.
        Slows them down based on a drag coefficent.
        Does NOT detect collisions.

      • checkPocketSink

        private void checkPocketSink(int index)
        Checks if a pool ball is within a pocket and scores it if so. Takes an index so it can modifiy the poolballs array.
        Parameters:
        index - The index the pool ball is at

      • checkWallCollision

        private void checkWallCollision(PoolBall p)
        Checks if a pool ball is about to collide with a wall and calculates the bounce.
        Parameters:
        p - The pool ball to check

      • checkCollision

        private void checkCollision(PoolBall a,
                            PoolBall b)
        Checks for a collision between the two balls and calculates the collision if one has occured.
        Parameters:
        a - One of the pool balls, non-null
        b - A different pool ball, non-null

      • processStimulus

        public void processStimulus(java.util.Iterator<org.jogamp.java3d.WakeupCriterion> arg0)
        Specified by:
        processStimulus in class org.jogamp.java3d.Behavior
